title: Implement Document.createCDATASection for XML documents
description:
The Document.createCDATASection() method is required for XML documents. This method creates a CDATASection node containing the specified data.

Per the DOM spec:
- CDATASection is only valid in XML documents, not HTML documents
- In HTML documents, createCDATASection should throw a NotSupportedError DOMException
- CDATASection extends CharacterData

WPT tests affected:
- Node-insertBefore.html (uses createCDATASection in pre-insertion-validation-notfound.js)
- Document-createCDATASection.html

Implementation needed:
1. Add CDATASectionNode constant to dom/node.go
2. Implement CreateCDATASection method in dom/document.go
3. Add JS binding in js/dom_bindings.go
4. Add BindCDATASectionNode similar to BindCommentNode
close_reason: Closed

title: Fix DOMTokenList duplicate handling and indexing
description:
DOMTokenList has issues per WPT Element-classlist.html:
1. Duplicate tokens are not being deduplicated - 'a a' should have length 1, not 2
2. Index access via classList[0] returns undefined instead of the token
3. Item() method not returning correct values

Implementation:
1. Add deduplication when tokens are parsed
2. Implement numeric indexer support for goja objects
3. Fix item() to properly return tokens

This affects 630+ tests in the WPT classList suite.
close_reason: Fixed DOMTokenList: deduplication (now 'a a' has length 1), numeric index access (classList[0] now works), and replace deduplication. WPT test passes 915 tests now.

title: Implement DOM interfaces (Node, Element, Document)
description:
Implement the core DOM interfaces that are required for WPT tests. The DOM must conform to the DOM Living Standard.

Required interfaces:
1. Node - base interface with nodeType, nodeName, nodeValue, parentNode, childNodes, firstChild, lastChild, previousSibling, nextSibling, appendChild, removeChild, insertBefore, replaceChild, cloneNode, normalize, textContent
2. Document - createElement, createElement(NS), createTextNode, createComment, createDocumentFragment, getElementById, getElementsByTagName, getElementsByClassName, querySelector, querySelectorAll, documentElement, head, body, title
3. Element - tagName, id, className, classList, getAttribute, setAttribute, removeAttribute, hasAttribute, attributes, innerHTML, outerHTML, children, firstElementChild, lastElementChild, matches, closest
4. Text, Comment, DocumentFragment, Attr interfaces
5. NodeList and HTMLCollection (live collections)
6. DOMTokenList for classList
7. NamedNodeMap for attributes

Reference: https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/

This is the JavaScript-accessible API that WPT tests use to verify browser behavior.
close_reason: Implemented complete DOM interfaces package with Node, Element, Document, Text, Comment, DocumentFragment, NodeList, HTMLCollection, DOMTokenList, NamedNodeMap, and Attr. All tests pass.

title: Fix doctype ordering validation in insertBefore
description:
Some doctype ordering edge cases in Document.insertBefore are not properly validated. WPT test failures:

1. 'If the context node is a document and a doctype is following the reference child, inserting a DocumentFragment with an element should throw HierarchyRequestError'
2. 'If the context node is a document, inserting an element before the doctype should throw HierarchyRequestError'

The current implementation doesn't check if there's a doctype AFTER the reference child when inserting elements. Per the DOM spec, you can't insert an element before a doctype - they must come after.

Fix needed in dom/node.go in the insertBefore validation logic - add check for doctype following the reference child.
close_reason: Fixed doctype ordering validation: now checks if reference child IS a doctype, not just if doctype follows. Tests passing: 35/40 (was 33/40)

title: Add ChildNode mixin to DocumentType nodes
description:
DocumentType nodes are missing the ChildNode mixin methods (remove, before, after, replaceWith). This causes WPT test failures in Node-insertBefore.html and DocumentType-remove.html.

The issue is in js/dom_bindings.go where DocumentTypeNode falls through to the generic binding without the ChildNode mixin methods.

Fix needed:
1. Create a BindDocumentTypeNode function that includes ChildNode mixin methods
2. Add DocumentTypeNode case to the switch in BindNode
3. Ensure DocumentType-specific properties (name, publicId, systemId) are bound
close_reason: Added BindDocumentTypeNode function with name, publicId, systemId properties and ChildNode mixin methods. Tests passing: 33/40 in Node-insertBefore (was 32/40)

title: Fix CharacterData and Element WPT compliance issues
description:
Several WPT tests are failing due to incorrect handling in DOM bindings:

1. **CharacterData.length** returns byte length instead of UTF-16 code units (Go rune count). This causes failures on Unicode strings like '資料' (expected 2, got 6) and emoji strings.

2. **CharacterData.data setter** converts null to 'null' string instead of empty string. Per spec, setting data to null should result in empty string.

3. **Comment/Text constructors** - new Comment(undefined) and new Text(undefined) should treat undefined as empty string, not convert to 'undefined' string.

4. **Element.prefix** property is not implemented - returns undefined instead of null. Tests expect null for elements without a prefix.

5. **DOMImplementation.createDocument** not implemented - needed for XML/XHTML document tests.

Affected WPT tests:
- /dom/nodes/CharacterData-data.html (6 failures)
- /dom/nodes/Comment-constructor.html (1 failure)  
- /dom/nodes/Document-createElement.html (many failures due to prefix and createDocument)
close_reason: Fixed CharacterData, Comment/Text constructors, Element.prefix, and createElement namespace issues. All related WPT tests now pass.

title: Fix Element.textContent setter for null/undefined values
description:
When setting Element.textContent to null or undefined, the spec says they should be treated as an empty string, but currently they are stringified literally as 'null' or 'undefined'.

WPT test /dom/nodes/Node-textContent.html failures:
- 'Element without children set to null' - expected '' but got 'null'
- 'Element with children set to null' - expected '' but got 'null'  
- 'Element without children set to undefined' - expected '' but got 'undefined'
- 'Element with children set to undefined' - expected '' but got 'undefined'

Files to modify:
- js/dom_bindings.go - In Element textContent setter, check for null/undefined and convert to empty string before calling SetTextContent

title: Expose HTMLCollection constructor for WPT tests
description:
The WPT test /dom/nodes/Document-getElementsByClassName.html fails because HTMLCollection is not defined as a global constructor.

The test error is:
  'getElementsByClassName() should be a live collection' - HTMLCollection is not defined

We need to expose HTMLCollection in the JavaScript global scope so that tests can use it for instanceof checks and similar operations.

Files to modify:
- js/runtime.go or js/dom_bindings.go - Add HTMLCollection as a global constructor/prototype

title: Implement CSS box model and layout engine
description:
Implement the CSS visual formatting model and box layout.

Box model:
1. Content, padding, border, margin boxes
2. box-sizing (content-box, border-box)
3. Width and height calculations (auto, percentages, min/max constraints)

Block formatting context:
1. Block-level element layout
2. Margin collapsing
3. Clearance and floats

Inline formatting context:
1. Line boxes and inline boxes
2. Text alignment
3. vertical-align
4. white-space handling

Visual formatting model:
1. Normal flow positioning
2. Float positioning
3. Absolute and fixed positioning
4. Stacking contexts and z-index

Additional:
1. Overflow handling (visible, hidden, scroll, auto)
2. Display property (block, inline, inline-block, none, flex basics)
3. Containing blocks

Reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visuren.html and https://www.w3.org/TR/css-box-3/
close_reason: Implemented CSS box model and layout engine with block and inline layout, positioning, box-sizing, margins, padding, borders, floats, and comprehensive test coverage

title: Implement DOMImplementation.createHTMLDocument
description:
DOMImplementation.createHTMLDocument() is missing, which is needed by many WPT tests to create new document objects for testing. This is one of the most-needed methods for WPT compliance.

Implementation:
1. Add createHTMLDocument(title) method to DOMImplementation
2. Should create a new Document with:
   - doctype: html
   - html element with head and body children
   - title element in head if title param provided
3. Bind it to JavaScript via the DOMBinder

Files:
- dom/document.go - add createHTMLDocument to DOMImplementation 
- js/dom_bindings.go - bind to JS

Many WPT tests depend on this for isolation between tests.
close_reason: Implemented DOMImplementation with createHTMLDocument, createDocument, createDocumentType, and hasFeature methods. Added proper JavaScript bindings with prototype chain support. All DOMImplementation tests now pass.

title: Initialize Go module and project structure
description: Create go.mod for the viberowser project. Set up the initial package structure with directories for: html (parser), css (parser), layout, render, ui, and wpt (test integration). Create a minimal main.go that can be built.
close_reason: Closed

title: Implement ProcessingInstruction node type and createProcessingInstruction
description:
The DOM needs to support ProcessingInstruction nodes (nodeType 7). This requires:

1. Add ProcessingInstruction node type constant in dom/node.go
2. Implement ProcessingInstruction structure with target and data properties
3. Add createProcessingInstruction(target, data) method to Document
4. Add JavaScript bindings for ProcessingInstruction in js/dom_bindings.go
5. The ProcessingInstruction interface should:
   - Have nodeType = 7
   - Have nodeName = target (the target part before the data)
   - Have nodeValue = data (the content after the target)
   - Implement CharacterData interface (data, length, substringData, etc.)
   - Be a leaf node (cannot have children)

Per DOM spec, ProcessingInstruction looks like: <?target data?>

Many WPT tests fail due to missing createProcessingInstruction:
- Text.appendChild(ProcessingInstruction)
- Comment.appendChild(ProcessingInstruction)
- insertBefore tests with ProcessingInstruction
- Multiple CharacterData-appendChild tests
close_reason: Implemented ProcessingInstruction node type with full CharacterData interface support, createProcessingInstruction document method with proper validation, and JavaScript bindings

title: Add CharacterData mutation methods to JS bindings
description:
The CharacterData interface is missing JS bindings for the following methods:
- appendData(data)
- deleteData(offset, count)
- insertData(offset, data)
- replaceData(offset, count, data)
- substringData(offset, count)

These methods exist in the Go dom/text.go file but are not exposed to JavaScript. The WPT tests for these methods are failing because of this.

Implementation:
1. Add appendData binding - appends a string to the data
2. Add deleteData binding - removes characters from offset for count
3. Add insertData binding - inserts string at offset
4. Add replaceData binding - replaces characters starting at offset
5. Add substringData binding - returns substring from offset for count

All methods need proper error handling per spec (e.g., IndexSizeError for invalid offsets).

Files to modify:
- js/dom_bindings.go - add method bindings to BindTextNode and BindCommentNode or create shared helper

Test with: go run /tmp/wpt_char.go after implementation
close_reason: Implemented CharacterData mutation methods (appendData, deleteData, insertData, replaceData, substringData) in JS bindings with proper DOMException support. All 112 CharacterData WPT tests now pass.

title: Implement Window.frames property for WPT tests
description:
WPT tests use window.frames to create iframe documents for testing. The tests fail with 'frames is not defined'.

Tests failing:
- 'Appending a document: frames is not defined'
- 'Adopting an orphan: frames is not defined'
- 'Adopting a non-orphan: frames is not defined'

Implementation needed:
1. Add frames property to Window object in js/runtime.go
2. frames should be an HTMLCollection of window objects for each iframe
3. For now, can return an empty collection or minimal implementation
4. frames[i] should return the contentWindow of the i-th iframe

This is needed for tests that create documents via iframes:
```javascript
var doc = frames[0].document;
```
close_reason: Implemented window.frames property with iframe content window support. Tests that were failing with 'frames is not defined' now pass.

title: Implement WPT test harness integration
description:
Implement infrastructure to run Web Platform Tests against Viberowser.

WPT Setup:
1. Clone/checkout WPT repository
2. Implement wpt server runner or use the provided wpt serve
3. Configure test paths

Test running:
1. Load testharness.js tests
2. Capture test results from JavaScript
3. Handle test timeouts
4. Support reftest comparison (screenshot comparison)
5. Parse test manifests

Results reporting:
1. Output results in standard WPT format
2. Track pass/fail/skip counts
3. Generate HTML report of results
4. Compare against baseline

CI integration:
1. Run subset of WPT on each commit
2. Track test pass rate over time

Reference: https://web-platform-tests.org/running-tests/
close_reason: Implemented WPT test harness integration with testharness.js binding, test runner, and wptrun CLI tool. All tests pass.

title: Implement Element.style property (CSSStyleDeclaration)
description:
The Element.style property is a critical CSSOM interface that exposes inline styles as a CSSStyleDeclaration object. Many WPT tests depend on this.

The style property should:
1. Be a CSSStyleDeclaration object
2. Support reading/writing CSS properties as camelCase properties (element.style.backgroundColor)
3. Support cssText property to get/set the full style attribute string
4. Support getPropertyValue(), setProperty(), removeProperty() methods
5. Support item() and length for iteration
6. Sync changes back to the element's style attribute

This is a significant feature that unlocks many CSSOM tests.

Files to modify:
- dom/element.go - May need Style() method that returns CSSStyleDeclaration
- js/dom_bindings.go - Add style property to Element binding
- May need new css/style_declaration.go for CSSStyleDeclaration implementation

title: Add HierarchyRequestError validation to Node mutation methods
description:
Node mutation methods (appendChild, insertBefore, etc.) should throw HierarchyRequestError when:
1. Appending a non-Node (should be TypeError)
2. Appending to Text/Comment nodes (they can't have children)
3. Appending a document's ancestor back to itself
4. Other hierarchy violations per the spec

Currently these methods just fail silently or don't throw the correct exception type.

Test file: /dom/nodes/Node-appendChild.html
close_reason: Implemented HierarchyRequestError validation for Node mutation methods. All critical WPT tests pass including TypeError for non-Node arguments, HierarchyRequestError for leaf nodes and ancestor insertion, and NotFoundError for invalid reference children.

title: Implement HTML5 tokenizer (lexer)
description:
Implement a complete HTML5 tokenizer following the WHATWG HTML parsing specification. The tokenizer should:

1. Handle all token types: DOCTYPE, start tags, end tags, comments, character data, and EOF
2. Implement state machine with states like Data, TagOpen, TagName, BeforeAttributeName, AttributeName, AfterAttributeName, BeforeAttributeValue, AttributeValue (quoted/unquoted), SelfClosingStartTag, etc.
3. Handle character references (named, decimal, hexadecimal)
4. Support proper error handling and parse error recovery
5. Handle CDATA sections, RCDATA, RAWTEXT, PLAINTEXT, and Script data states

Reference: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#tokenization

This is foundational for the HTML parser and must be spec-compliant to pass WPT tests.
close_reason: Implemented HTML5 tokenizer and parser using golang.org/x/net/html library. The package provides both tokenization (via our Tokenizer wrapper) and full HTML5-compliant parsing (via Parse/ParseReader functions). All 20 tests pass covering basic document parsing, malformed HTML handling, attributes, DOM manipulation, entity decoding, self-closing tags, and table structure.

title: Add missing Element properties to JS DOM bindings
description:
The DOM Element class has several important properties implemented in Go but not bound to JavaScript. These need to be added to support WPT tests.

Missing JavaScript bindings for Element:
- children (HTMLCollection of child elements)
- childElementCount
- firstElementChild
- lastElementChild
- previousElementSibling
- nextElementSibling

These properties exist in dom/element.go but need JS bindings in js/dom_bindings.go
close_reason: Added children, childElementCount, firstElementChild, lastElementChild, previousElementSibling, and nextElementSibling properties to JS DOM bindings for both Element and Document. Added corresponding Go methods to Document (Children, ChildElementCount, FirstElementChild, LastElementChild). All tests pass.

title: Implement browser UI with tabs and URL bar
description:
Implement the browser user interface with essential navigation features.

UI Components:
1. Main window with title bar
2. Tab bar with support for multiple tabs
   - New tab button
   - Close tab button (X on each tab)
   - Tab switching
   - Tab drag reordering (stretch goal)
3. URL bar / address bar
   - Text input for URLs
   - Go button or Enter key navigation
   - URL display and editing
4. Navigation controls
   - Back button
   - Forward button
   - Refresh button
   - Stop/loading indicator
5. Content area for rendered page

GUI Framework:
1. Evaluate options: fyne.io, gotk3, go-gtk, webview, gio
2. Fyne is pure Go and cross-platform, good starting point
3. Must work in X11 environment (devcontainer has DISPLAY=:1)

Keyboard shortcuts:
1. Ctrl+T: New tab
2. Ctrl+W: Close tab
3. Ctrl+L: Focus URL bar

This provides the user-facing browser experience.
close_reason: Implemented browser UI with Fyne GUI toolkit including tabs, URL bar, navigation controls, and keyboard shortcuts

title: Integrate JavaScript engine (goja or v8go)
description:
Integrate a JavaScript engine to execute scripts in web pages. This is essential for running WPT testharness.js tests.

Options to evaluate:
1. goja (github.com/dop251/goja) - Pure Go ES5.1+ implementation, easy to integrate but limited ES6+
2. v8go (github.com/nicholascross/nicgo) - V8 bindings for Go, full ES6+ but requires CGO
3. Consider other options like duktape-go

Requirements:
1. Create a JS runtime that can execute scripts
2. Expose DOM APIs to JavaScript (window, document, Element, etc.)
3. Implement console.log/warn/error for debugging
4. Implement setTimeout/setInterval/requestAnimationFrame
5. Implement event handling (addEventListener, dispatchEvent)
6. Handle script parsing errors gracefully

The JS engine must support enough ES6+ features to run testharness.js which is used by WPT.

Start with goja for simplicity, can upgrade to v8go later if needed.
close_reason: Implemented JS engine integration using goja with full DOM bindings, events, timers, and script execution. All 46 tests pass.

title: Implement HTML5 tree builder
description:
Implement the HTML5 tree construction algorithm following the WHATWG spec. This depends on the tokenizer.

Key requirements:
1. Implement the tree construction dispatcher with all insertion modes:
   - Initial, BeforeHtml, BeforeHead, InHead, InHeadNoscript, AfterHead
   - InBody, Text, InTable, InTableText, InCaption, InColumnGroup
   - InTableBody, InRow, InCell, InSelect, InSelectInTable
   - InTemplate, AfterBody, InFrameset, AfterFrameset, AfterAfterBody, AfterAfterFrameset

2. Handle the stack of open elements and active formatting elements
3. Implement foster parenting for misnested content
4. Handle scripting (script execution integration points)
5. Implement adoption agency algorithm for formatting element handling
6. Support template element handling

Reference: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#tree-construction

This produces the DOM tree that CSS and JavaScript will work with.
close_reason: The HTML5 tree builder is provided by golang.org/x/net/html.Parse() which implements the full WHATWG HTML5 tree construction algorithm. Our html.Parse() and html.ParseReader() functions wrap this functionality, returning a well-structured DOM tree. Tests verify correct handling of document structure, implicit element insertion (e.g., tbody), and proper parent-child relationships.

title: Implement rendering/painting engine
description:
Implement the painting/rendering engine that produces visual output from the layout tree.

Painting:
1. Paint backgrounds (colors, images, gradients)
2. Paint borders (solid, dashed, dotted, etc.)
3. Paint text with proper fonts
4. Paint replaced elements (images)
5. Paint order following stacking contexts

Text rendering:
1. Font loading and selection
2. Font metrics (ascent, descent, line height)
3. Text shaping (basic Latin, possibly use harfbuzz-go)
4. Handle font-family fallbacks
5. font-weight, font-style, font-size

Graphics backend:
1. Use Go image library for basic rendering
2. Consider integrating with graphics libraries (e.g., gg, fogleman/gg)
3. Anti-aliasing for text and shapes
4. Alpha compositing

Output:
1. Render to image.Image for testing
2. Prepare for integration with GUI toolkit

Reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/zindex.html for painting order
close_reason: Implemented painting/rendering engine with backgrounds, borders (solid/dashed/dotted/double), text rendering with bitmap font, alpha compositing, stacking contexts, and drawing primitives (lines, circles, images)

title: Fix Document.textContent to return null per spec
description:
The Document.textContent property should return null per the DOM spec, but currently returns undefined.

WPT test /dom/nodes/Node-textContent.html fails with:
- 'For Documents created by parser, textContent should be null' - expected null but got undefined
- 'For Documents created by createDocument, textContent should be null' - expected null but got undefined  
- 'For Documents created by createHTMLDocument, textContent should be null' - expected null but got undefined

Additionally, setting textContent on Document should do nothing (be a no-op), but currently it may be setting something.

Files to modify:
- js/dom_bindings.go - BindDocument should return null (not undefined) for textContent getter, and setter should be a no-op

title: Implement CSS tokenizer and parser
description:
Implement a complete CSS tokenizer and parser following CSS Syntax Module Level 3.

Tokenizer requirements (https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/#tokenization):
1. Handle all token types: ident, function, at-keyword, hash, string, bad-string, url, bad-url, delim, number, percentage, dimension, whitespace, CDO, CDC, colon, semicolon, comma, brackets, etc.
2. Proper handling of escape sequences
3. Unicode code point handling

Parser requirements:
1. Parse stylesheet into rules (qualified rules, at-rules)
2. Parse selector lists with combinators (descendant, child, adjacent sibling, general sibling)
3. Parse declaration blocks with property-value pairs
4. Handle @import, @media, @font-face, @keyframes rules
5. Parse values into component values (functions, calc(), etc.)

Selector matching:
1. Implement specificity calculation
2. Implement selector matching against elements
3. Support all simple selectors: type, class, ID, attribute, pseudo-classes, pseudo-elements

Reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/ and https://www.w3.org/TR/selectors-4/
close_reason: Implemented complete CSS tokenizer and parser following CSS Syntax Module Level 3, including selector parsing, matching, and specificity calculation

title: Implement Document.createAttribute method
description:
The WPT tests show that Document.createAttribute is not implemented. This method creates an Attr node with the given name.

**Error from tests:**
`Object has no member 'createAttribute'`

**Spec:** https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-document-createattribute

**Implementation needs:**
1. Add createAttribute method to dom/document.go
2. Add JavaScript binding in js/dom_bindings.go  
3. Should validate the name per XML Name production rules
4. Should lowercase the name for HTML documents
5. Return an Attr object

**Related test file:** /dom/nodes/Document-createAttribute.html
close_reason: Implemented Document.createAttribute and createAttributeNS methods with BindAttr function. All 36 WPT tests pass.

title: Set up WPT test infrastructure
description:
To properly test the browser against Web Platform Tests, we need:

1. Clone the WPT repository or set up a way to run tests
2. Create a test script that can run a subset of tests
3. Identify which test categories to focus on first (likely DOM tests)

The wpt/ directory has a runner but needs actual WPT tests to run against.

Runner correctly runs real WPT tests and captures results. 20+ tests passed against Document-createComment.html and Comment-constructor.html. CI integration deferred to separate issue.

title: Implement HTTP client and resource loading
description:
Implement HTTP client for fetching web resources.

HTTP client:
1. GET, POST, HEAD requests
2. Request/response headers handling
3. Cookie jar and cookie handling
4. Redirect following (configurable limit)
5. HTTPS/TLS support
6. Timeout handling

Resource loading:
1. Fetch HTML documents
2. Load linked stylesheets (<link rel=stylesheet>)
3. Load <style> element content
4. Load scripts (sync and async/defer)
5. Load images (for later rendering)
6. Handle data: URLs
7. Relative URL resolution

Content-Type handling:
1. Parse Content-Type headers
2. Character encoding detection and conversion
3. Sniffing for type detection as fallback

Cache:
1. Basic HTTP caching (Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified)
2. In-memory cache for session

This is required to load actual web pages and WPT test resources.
close_reason: Implemented complete HTTP client and resource loading system with caching, cookie support, redirect handling, and external script/stylesheet loading

title: Implement CSS cascade and computed styles
description:
Implement CSS cascading and value computation.

Cascade requirements:
1. Implement cascade origins (user agent, user, author)
2. Handle !important declarations
3. Implement specificity-based ordering
4. Handle order of appearance for equal specificity

Inheritance:
1. Implement inherited vs non-inherited properties
2. Handle 'inherit', 'initial', 'unset', 'revert' keywords

Value computation:
1. Resolve relative values (em, rem, %, vh, vw, etc.)
2. Compute color values (named colors, hex, rgb, hsl, etc.)
3. Handle calc() expressions
4. Resolve currentColor
5. Apply default values for unspecified properties

Style tree:
1. Build a styled tree from DOM tree + stylesheets
2. Efficient selector matching
3. Cache computed styles for performance

Reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade-4/
close_reason: Implemented CSS cascade and computed styles following CSS Cascade Level 4 specification. Added cascade origins, !important handling, specificity ordering, inheritance, CSS-wide keywords (inherit/initial/unset/revert), relative unit resolution, color parsing, user agent stylesheet, and style tree construction.

title: Fix ChildNode before/after/replaceWith null/undefined conversion and sibling ordering
description:
Several WPT tests for ChildNode methods (before, after, replaceWith) are failing:

1. **Null/undefined conversion**: When null or undefined is passed as an argument, it should be converted to the string 'null' or 'undefined' respectively. Currently they are being skipped/ignored.

2. **Sibling ordering**: When multiple siblings are passed to these methods, the ordering is incorrect. For example:
   - after(x, y, z) where x, y, z are already siblings should result in correct order
   - Currently produces wrong order like <y><z><x> instead of <x><y><z>

Failing tests:
- /dom/nodes/ChildNode-after.html (18 failures)
- /dom/nodes/ChildNode-before.html (6 failures) 
- /dom/nodes/ChildNode-replaceWith.html (15 failures)
close_reason: Fixed all WPT failures for ChildNode methods (before, after, replaceWith). All 123 tests pass.

title: Fix insertBefore to accept optional second argument
description:
The insertBefore JavaScript binding currently requires 2 arguments, but per DOM spec the second argument (refChild) should be optional and default to null.

Current behavior in js/dom_bindings.go line 1977-1980:
```go
if len(call.Arguments) < 2 {
    panic(vm.NewTypeError("Failed to execute 'insertBefore' on 'Node': 2 arguments required."))
}
```

Expected behavior: 
- insertBefore(node) should work the same as insertBefore(node, null)
- insertBefore(node, null) appends the node as the last child

WPT tests failing include:
- 'If node is a host-including inclusive ancestor of parent, then throw a HierarchyRequestError'
- 'If node is not a DocumentFragment, DocumentType, Element, Text, ProcessingInstruction, or Comment node...'
- Many other document hierarchy tests

Fix: Change to accept 1+ arguments and treat missing/undefined second argument as null.
close_reason: Fixed insertBefore.length to return 2 by using typed parameters, and added missing doctype accessor to bindDocumentInternal. WPT tests improved from 15 passed to 30 passed.

title: Implement ParentNode/ChildNode mixin methods
description:
The DOM is missing important ParentNode and ChildNode mixin methods that are commonly tested in WPT:

ParentNode mixin (for Document, DocumentFragment, Element):
- append(...nodes) - append nodes or strings
- prepend(...nodes) - prepend nodes or strings
- replaceChildren(...nodes) - replace all children

ChildNode mixin (for Element, CharacterData):
- before(...nodes) - insert before this node
- after(...nodes) - insert after this node
- replaceWith(...nodes) - replace this node
- remove() - already implemented

These need to be added to dom/ and bound in js/dom_bindings.go
close_reason: Implemented ParentNode mixin methods (append, prepend, replaceChildren) for Element, Document, and DocumentFragment. Implemented ChildNode mixin methods (before, after, replaceWith, remove) for Element, Text, and Comment nodes. Added JS bindings for all methods. Added comprehensive tests.

title: Fix DocumentFragment.textContent implementation
description:
The DocumentFragment.textContent property is not properly implemented. The WPT test /dom/nodes/Node-textContent.html shows:

1. Getting textContent on DocumentFragment returns undefined instead of concatenated text content
2. Setting textContent on DocumentFragment doesn't properly:
   - Replace all children with a single text node
   - Handle null/undefined (should be treated as empty string)
   - Handle numeric values (should be converted to string)

The spec says DocumentFragment should behave like Element for textContent - returning concatenated descendant text content on get, and replacing all children with a text node on set.

Files to modify:
- dom/document_fragment.go - Add proper TextContent() and SetTextContent() methods
- js/dom_bindings.go - Ensure proper binding with getter/setter
